justification: The reference "Assessing aesthetic appreciation of visual artworks – The construction of the Art Reception Survey (ARS)" indicates that the ARS was specifically devised to measure aesthetic appreciation of visual artworks.

"The task of making an aesthetic judgment was embedded into a n-back working memory task manipulating the load of visual working memory throughout the aesthetic rating task," showing that visual working-memory load was operationalized by the n-back task.
"Subjects rated photographs of interior architectural spaces both according to beauty and pleasure," demonstrating that beauty evaluations were gathered through explicit beauty ratings.
The same sentence notes that participants provided "pleasure ratings," indicating that hedonic pleasure was measured via self-reported pleasure ratings.
